page.title: 07Chatteris - Land Use
page.content: Barley is the most populor crop in this area. Also rape, wheat, peas, beans, sugar beet, potatoes and carrots are grown in large fields. Most of these crops are suited to clayey soil, where they grow best. This clayey soil is to the South of our area where the land rises to 10' above sea level. As the land drops to 5'below sea level there is the edge of a three mile wide stretch of peaty soil which is ideal for the carrots for which Chatteris Fens are famous. In Byall Fen there is a sixty acre field of carrots. In How and Nightlayer's Fen the most populor crop is barley,and in Langwood Fen there are lots of potatoes. Some of these potatoes are used in the making of some very famous crisps.
